    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Game Hunter Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3425) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Quest for the Frozen Flame</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #175: Broken Tusk Moon](/Sources.aspx?ID=112) pg. 81</row>

**Archetype** [Game Hunter](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=169)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16)

</column>

---

You are skilled at tracking big game animals and similar creatures. You gain the [Hunt Prey](/Actions.aspx?ID=10) action, but you can designate only [animals](/Traits.aspx?ID=9), [beasts](/Traits.aspx?ID=20), and [dragons](/Traits.aspx?ID=50) as prey. In addition to the other benefits of Hunt Prey, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) checks against your hunted prey.

 When you succeed at a Strike against your hunted prey while it's [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16), it must attempt a Fortitude save against your class DC. On a failure, the prey's Speeds are each reduced by 10 feet for 1 round; on a critical failure, the duration of this effect is 1 minute. The prey is then temporarily immune to this effect for 10 minutes.

 If you already have Hunt Prey, you become an expert in [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16). You apply the Stealth bonus and the Speed reduction only when your prey is an animal, beast, or dragon.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the game hunter archetype.

<title level="2">Game Hunter Dedication leads to...</title>
[Big Game Trapper](/Feats.aspx?ID=3426), [Keep Pace](/Feats.aspx?ID=3427), [Quick Positioning](/Feats.aspx?ID=3428)
